name: repugnance
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a feeling of disgust caused by behaviour or beliefs, etc. that are very unpleasant: The thought of eating meat fills me with repugnance. Overcoming his physical repugnance, he reached out to touch the wound. She is repelled by both his repugnancy and his terrible behaviour.
More examplesFewer examplesI felt utter repugnance toward him.I tried to overcome my natural repugnance.the moral repugnance provoked by the idea of keeping animals in enclosures
